name: Linux Switches
description: Commands for switching between Linux distributions and environments

commands.name: Switch to Ubuntu
commands.description: Switches the default shell to Ubuntu's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to Debian
commands.description: Switches the default shell to Debian's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to CentOS
commands.description: Switches the default shell to CentOS's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to Fedora
commands.description: Switches the default shell to Fedora's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to Arch Linux
commands.description: Switches the default shell to Arch Linux's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to openSUSE
commands.description: Switches the default shell to openSUSE's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to Linux Mint
commands.description: Switches the default shell to Linux Mint's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to Elementary OS
commands.description: Switches the default shell to Elementary OS's bash configuration. This command allows you to change between different bash installations and configurations available on your system.

commands.name: Switch to Zsh
commands.description: Changes the default shell to Zsh. Zsh is a powerful shell that provides advanced features like advanced completion, spelling correction, and extensive customization options.

commands.name: Switch to Bash
commands.description: Changes the default shell back to Bash. Bash is the default shell for most Linux distributions and provides a stable, feature-rich command-line environment.

commands.name: Switch to Fish
commands.description: Changes the default shell to Fish. Fish is a smart and user-friendly command line shell with features like syntax highlighting, autosuggestions, and web-based configuration.

commands.name: Switch to Tcsh
commands.description: Changes the default shell to Tcsh. Tcsh is an enhanced version of the C shell with features like command-line completion, spelling correction, and job control.

commands.name: Switch to Ksh
commands.description: Changes the default shell to Ksh (Korn shell). Ksh is a Unix shell that combines features of the Bourne shell and C shell, with additional features like command-line editing.

commands.name: Switch to Dash
commands.description: Changes the default shell to Dash. Dash is a POSIX-compliant shell that is smaller and faster than Bash, often used as the default /bin/sh on many Linux distributions.

commands.name: Switch Python Environment
commands.description: Activates a Python virtual environment. Virtual environments allow you to isolate Python dependencies for different projects, preventing conflicts between package versions.

commands.name: Switch Node.js Version
commands.description: Switches to a specific Node.js version using NVM (Node Version Manager). This allows you to easily switch between different Node.js versions for different projects.

commands.name: Switch Ruby Version
commands.description: Switches to a specific Ruby version using rbenv. This allows you to manage multiple Ruby versions on the same system and switch between them as needed.

commands.name: Switch PHP Version
commands.description: Switches to a specific PHP version using update-alternatives. This allows you to change the default PHP version used by the system and web servers.

commands.name: Switch Java Version
commands.description: Switches between installed Java versions using update-alternatives. This allows you to change the default Java version used by applications and development tools.

commands.name: Switch GCC Version
commands.description: Switches between installed GCC compiler versions using update-alternatives. This allows you to change the default C/C++ compiler used for building software.

commands.name: Switch Python Version
commands.description: Switches between installed Python versions using update-alternatives. This allows you to change the default Python interpreter used by the system and applications.

commands.name: Switch Desktop Environment
commands.description: Switches the default desktop environment or display manager. This allows you to change between different desktop environments like GNOME, KDE, XFCE, or LXDE.

commands.name: Switch Display Manager
commands.description: Switches the default display manager (login screen). This allows you to change between different display managers like GDM, LightDM, SDDM, or XDM.

commands.name: Switch Network Manager
commands.description: Switches the default network management service. This allows you to change between different network managers like NetworkManager, systemd-networkd, or Wicd.

commands.name: Switch Package Manager
commands.description: Switches between different package managers or package manager frontends. This allows you to change the default package management tool used for installing software.

commands.name: Switch Terminal Emulator
commands.description: Switches the default terminal emulator for the X Window System. This allows you to change between different terminal emulators like GNOME Terminal, Konsole, or xterm.

commands.name: Switch Default Text Editor
commands.description: Switches the default text editor used by system commands. This allows you to change between different text editors like nano, vim, emacs, or other editors.

commands.name: Switch Default Browser
commands.description: Switches the default web browser for the system. This allows you to change between different browsers like Firefox, Chrome, Chromium, or other web browsers.

commands.name: Switch Default Mail Client
commands.description: Switches the default mail client for the system. This allows you to change between different mail clients like Thunderbird, Evolution, or other email applications.

commands.name: Switch Default File Manager
commands.description: Switches the default file manager for the system. This allows you to change between different file managers like Nautilus, Dolphin, Thunar, or other file management applications.
